introduction: Dr. Liyue Fan is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science at UNC Charlotte, with an affiliated appointment in the School of Data Science. She was named one of the "Rising Stars in EECS" by MIT in 2015 and is a recipient of the prestigious NSF CAREER award. Her research, which focuses on data privacy and databases, is supported by the National Science Foundation. Prior to joining UNC Charlotte, she was an Assistant Professor at the University at Albany and a postdoctoral research associate at the University of Southern California. Dr. Fan earned her Ph.D. in Computer Science from Emory University and her B.S. in Mathematics from Zhejiang University
